thread.title_full: Finn Jones has a pretty amazing theory on how Game of Thrones will eventually end - Game of Thrones News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Finn Jones has a pretty amazing theory on how Game of Thrones will eventually end - Game of Thrones Cult -
text: There's been so much debate about how and when Game of Thrones will eventually end – but we like cast member Finn Jones's theory the most.The cast of HBO's Emmy-winning fantasy series were quizzed on the approaching end of Game of Thrones during a panel today (October 8) at New York Comic-Con. © PA Images / Lewis Whyld/PA Archive Game of Thrones season 6: Everything we know so far from plot spoilers to premiere dateThe best theory came from Ser Loras Tyrell actor Finn Jones, who thinks that the key could be in the title of George RR Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire book series."Basically I think there will be a big battle between Ice and Fire," he guessed. "My theory is they're going to have to dissolve the Iron Throne to defeat the White Walkers … and then I think out of the ashes will come the tree people, they'll grow [out the new world]. "Bran, Hodor, Tyrion [will survive] to bring peace back to the realm. But knowing Game of Thrones, it'll be Littlefinger on the throne and there will be no help."In terms of Ser Loras's own future? Jones doesn't expect things to end well for the closeted knight, since he's stuck in High Sparrow's prison."He's in the hands of some very nasty people," the actor admitted. "And they don't agree with him, so you should be worried." © HBO While no official end date has been set for Game of Thrones yet, HBO president Michael Lombardo hinted in July at an eighth season wrap-up."I think seven seasons and out has never been the conversation; the question is how much beyond the seventh season are we going to do," Lombardo explained."[The producers are] feeling like there's probably two more years after six. I would love for them to change their minds, but that's what we're looking at right now."Earlier in October, author George RR Martin shot down rumours that a movie is already in development to follow Game of Thrones.Martin's own next instalment of the Song of Ice and Fire series - The Winds of Winter - is expected to finally be released next year.Game of Thrones returns to HBO and Sky Atlantic in 2016.
